data.scheme_name: Special Incentives Scheme for ESDM Sector 2020-25 - Capital Investment Subsidy - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provide 25 % subsidy on land value maximum upto Rs.1250 lakhs and 20% subsidy on plant and machinery.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in electronics systems design and manufacturing are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
The company or entity should be registered in Karnataka under the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishment Act, 1961. 
The Land Subsidy shall be applicable for land only in areas other than Bengaluru Urban and Bengaluru Rural districts.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in electronics systems design and manufacturing are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
The company or entity should be registered in Karnataka under the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishment Act, 1961. The Land Subsidy shall be applicable for land only in areas other than Bengaluru Urban and Bengaluru Rural districts. The units receiving incentive shall have to remain in commercial production for a period of at least 3 (three) years from the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production or 1 (one) year from the date of receipt of last incentive, whichever is later. 
  • Units should fulfill the specified employment criteria based on capital expenditure in plant and machinery.
    • Enterprises must fulfill the below criteria for availing incentives under the scheme- 15 jobs per Rs.1500 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery and then 7 additional jobs for every additional Rs1000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery. 
  • 50 jobs per Rs.5000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery and then 35 additional jobs for every additional Rs.5000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery.
data.context: Government of Karnataka, through Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society (KITS), Department of Electronics, IT, BT and S&T, has announced the Special Incentives Scheme for ESDM Sector 2020 - 2025 (hereinafter called the “Scheme”) effective from 7th September 2020, offering various incentives & concessions to ESDM companies in the State.
data.objective: To boost electronics manufacturing in India by attracting investments, fostering innovation, creating jobs, and enhancing global competitiveness. It offers financial incentives to promote self-reliance, strengthen domestic supply chains, and support advanced technologies in sectors like mobile phones, IoT, and semiconductor design.
data.description:
Scheme shall provide up to 25% subsidy on land value up to an extent of 50 acres. The total Land Subsidy shall be capped at Rs 1250 lakhs.
Also up to 20% subsidy on investment in Plant & Machinery, whether imported or procured domestically.
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant can apply with the required document in the below mentioned portal - 
itbtst.karnataka.gov.in.
data.funding_mechanism:
1. KITS shall disburse the funds upon completion of all pre- disbursal formalities by the Applicant. 
  2. The disbursement of incentive may be in the form of Direct Bank Transfer.
data.additional_info:
Expansion - A Project/ Unit in Karnataka that has existing capacity of the goods proposed to be manufactured and there is an increase in fixed capital investment on or after 7th September 2020, in additional manufacturing lines to enhance capacity of the proposed goods (as per SPECS). 
Existing - Company / Enterprise in Karnataka which have commenced commercial production before 7th September 2020.
Modernization - A Project / Unit in Karnataka that has existing capacity of the goods proposed to be manufactured and there is an increase in fixed capital investment on or after 7th September 2020, to enhance, optimize / revamp the existing capacity of the proposed goods (as per SPECS).
data.checklist_info_a:
Land Subsidy
1. Land Documents 
a) Land Document: Absolute Sale Deed and Records of Rights, Tenancy & Crops (RTC) in case of purchase. (or) 
b) Land Document: Sale cum lease deed in case of allotment from Government organizations. 
c) Land Document: Allotment Letter or Possession Certificate for KIADB in case of land leased from KIADB.
2. Certificate from Company Secretary / Chartered 
Accountant shall contain: 
a) Land is in the name of Applicant or Applicant has 
right to use land
b) No litigations on aforesaid land 
c) Land is meant for industrial use 
d) All clearances required (Statutory clearances, 
environmental clearances etc.) have been obtained 
for undertaking manufacturing activity at the 
proposed location 
e) UDIN of the CA / Company Secretary
3. CA Certified copy of Statement on Expenditure Incurred 
under Capital Investment (Annexure 4A) with UDIN 
Number
Plant and Machinery Subsidy
1. Copies of all invoices / Purchase Orders relevant to the 
investment in the name of Applicant along with 
corresponding GSTR 2A forms. 
2. Technology: Copy of Technology agreements with 
Technology provider (If applicable) 
3. Documents/ certificates required from Concerned 
Government Department 
a) Non-encumbrance certificate 
b) Certificate that the land is meant for industrial use in 
case privately acquired 
c) Building Completion Certificate
